titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4411) to prevent the use of certain payment instruments, credit cards, and fund transfers for unlawful Internet gambling, and for other purposes.
Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4411) to prevent the use of certain payment instruments, credit cards, and fund transfers for unlawful Internet gambling, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-551, by Mr. Gingrey.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4411 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. A specified amendment is in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 210.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 907.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214 - 189 (Roll no. 360).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 4411 (Unlawful Internet Gambling Enforcement Act of 2006).
